message.content:
cs.DS, cs.FL, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.DM

Reasoning: The paper deals with regular expressions for permutations, which is a topic in theoretical computer science. Specifically, the use of divide-and-conquer suggests an algorithmic approach, which is often studied in the sub-category of data structures (cs.DS). The construction of a regular expression also falls under the sub-category of formal languages (cs.FL). The analysis of the length of the regular expression and its optimality relates to computational complexity (cs.CC). The use of bounds and asymptotic notation suggests a connection to computational geometry (cs.CG) or discrete mathematics (cs.DM).
